import MethodEndpoint from "@theme/ApiExplorer/MethodEndpoint";

<Heading
  as={"h1"}
  className={"openapi__heading"}
  children={"List Grants"}
>
</Heading>

<MethodEndpoint
  method={"post"}
  path={"/user-svc/grants"}
  context={"endpoint"}
>
  
</MethodEndpoint>



Grants give access to users with certain slugs and roles to permissions.
Users can list grants for permissions they have access to
but they will only see grants the grant refers to their slug or one of their roles.

<Heading
  id={"request"}
  as={"h2"}
  className={"openapi-tabs__heading"}
  children={"Request"}
>
</Heading>

<ParamsDetails
  parameters={undefined}
>
  
</ParamsDetails>

<RequestSchema
  title={"Body"}
  body={{"content":{"application/json":{"schema":{"properties":{"permission":{"type":"string"},"slug":{"type":"string"}},"type":"object"}}},"description":"List Grants Request","required":true}}
>
  
</RequestSchema>

<StatusCodes
  id={undefined}
  label={undefined}
  responses={{"200":{"description":"OK","content":{"application/json":{"schema":{"properties":{"grants":{"items":{"properties":{"id":{"type":"string"},"permission":{"type":"string"},"roles":{"description":"Role IDs that have been granted the specified permission.\n\nOriginally, grants were designed for slugs to facilitate service-to-service calls.\nDue to their convenience—especially with CLI and infrastructure-as-code support—they were later extended to roles.\n\nAlternatively, permissions can be assigned to roles using UserSvc.AssignPermissions.\nGrants currently offer a more streamlined approach, though this may evolve over time.","items":{"type":"string"},"type":"array"},"slugs":{"description":"Slugs that have been granted the specified permission.","items":{"type":"string"},"type":"array"}},"required":["permission"],"type":"object"},"type":"array"}},"type":"object"}}}},"401":{"description":"Unauthorized","content":{"application/json":{"schema":{"properties":{"error":{"type":"string"}},"type":"object"}}}},"500":{"description":"Internal Server Error","content":{"application/json":{"schema":{"properties":{"error":{"type":"string"}},"type":"object"}}}}}}
>
  
</StatusCodes>
